task_summary: Detect the T block and goal zone, approach and align the end-effector, then push the T block in a straight line toward the marked goal, pause, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop pushing task: a UR-style arm with a cylindrical end-effector must push a T-shaped block across a white surface into a marked goal zone. The BT first ensures both the T block and the goal are visually located. The robot then moves above the block, aligns its tool to the intended push direction, and executes a single straight push toward the goal. A short wait stabilizes motion before the robot retreats. The scene shows the T starting left of the goal and ending near/inside the outlined zone. No grasping is used; only contact pushing.
preconditions: T block is present and visible
Goal zone is visible on the table
Robot reachable workspace includes start and goal
stepwise_plan: Perceive the T block and the goal zone.
Move above the T block and align tool yaw for a rightward push.
Advance to contact with the T and initiate the push.
Push the block toward the goal zone in one straight segment.
Briefly wait to settle, then retreat.
success_criteria: T block is inside or flush with the goal outline
Robot retreats without disturbing the final pose
No collisions with fixtures other than intended contact
failure_and_recovery: Perception miss: retry DetectObject up to 3 times
Under-push: re-run Push if goal not yet reached (operator/outer loop)
Excess friction causing stall: increase distance in next attempt
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after retreat following a completed push and a brief wait.

frame_3.now_evidence: First clear contact and alignment of tool with T’s stem; direction to the right is established.
frame_3.predicts_next: Sustained push should follow; T expected to translate toward goal.

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Locate the T block in the scene.
Move above the block with small clearance.
Center and align tool to push direction.
Set yaw for a rightward push.
Execute the push toward the goal zone.

failure_modes: Object not detected due to lighting or occlusion
Insufficient push distance due to friction
Tool slips off the T geometry
recovery_strategy: Issue a second Push with same direction
assumptions: Frames show a red T and a blue goal outline; colors differ from instruction (gray T, green target, blue circular tool). Frames were trusted over text.
Push direction interpreted as rightward (0°) based on motion from left to right.
Instruction’s 10 Hz detail does not map to library ports; left implicit.

expected_success_criteria: T ends within the goal outline with minimal orientation error
